directions: Heat the limestone in a kiln at high temperature (800-900°C) to convert it into quicklime.
Place the quicklime in a kiln and add the carbon dioxide gas to it.
The quicklime reacts with the carbon dioxide gas to produce calcium carbonate.
Allow the reaction to continue until the desired amount of calcium carbonate is formed.
Cool the calcium carbonate and store it in a suitable container.
Your calcium carbonate is ready to use!
